intro: Pedicularis gyroflexa, commonly known as the spiral monkey orchid, is a rare and striking member of the Orobanchaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas and is characterized by its unique spiral-shaped inflorescence. The plant produces vivid orange-red flowers that are highly specialized for pollination by specific insect species. Its growth is adapted to cold, alpine environments, and it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
